alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Northern Outer Banks; Ocracoke Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued November 09 at 4:01PM EST until November 10 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THURSDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level and ocean overwash in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 11 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Oceanside Northern Outer Banks, Ocracoke Island and Hatteras Island. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 7 AM EST Thursday. For the High Surf Advisory, until 10 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Up to 2 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in some areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in an elevated threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Ocean overwash is possible for portions of Hwy 12 in Hatteras and Ocracoke Islands. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The greatest coastal flooding impacts near inlets and beaches will be around the time of high tide between 730 and 9 AM tonight. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
